00054  * how to handle input data if bytes are not octets.

00769 #ifndef DOXYGEN_IGNORE

00771 /*
00772  * We want to define the types "sph_u32" and "sph_u64" which hold
00773  * unsigned values of at least, respectively, 32 and 64 bits. These
00774  * tests should select appropriate types for most platforms. The
00775  * macro "SPH_64" is defined if the 64-bit is supported.
00776  */
00777 
00778 #undef SPH_64
00779 #undef SPH_64_TRUE
00780 
00781 #if defined __STDC__ && __STDC_VERSION__ >= 199901L
00782 
00783 /*
00784  * On C99 implementations, we can use <stdint.h> to get an exact 64-bit
00785  * type, if any, or otherwise use a wider type (which must exist, for
00786  * C99 conformance).
00787  */
00788 
00789 #include <stdint.h>
00790 
00791 #ifdef UINT32_MAX
00792 typedef uint32_t sph_u32;
00793 typedef int32_t sph_s32;
00794 #else
00795 typedef uint_fast32_t sph_u32;
00796 typedef int_fast32_t sph_s32;
00797 #endif
00798 #ifdef UINT64_MAX
00799 typedef uint64_t sph_u64;
00800 typedef int64_t sph_s64;
00801 #else
00802 typedef uint_fast64_t sph_u64;
00803 typedef int_fast64_t sph_s64;
00804 #endif
00805 
00806 #define SPH_C32(x)    ((sph_u32)(x))
00807 #define SPH_C64(x)    ((sph_u64)(x))
00808 
00809 #define SPH_64  1
00810 
00811 #else
00812 
00813 /*
00814  * On non-C99 systems, we use "unsigned int" if it is wide enough,
00815  * "unsigned long" otherwise. This supports all "reasonable" architectures.
00816  * We have to be cautious: pre-C99 preprocessors handle constants
00817  * differently in '#if' expressions. Hence the shifts to test UINT_MAX.
00818  */
00819 
00820 #if ((UINT_MAX >> 11) >> 11) >= 0x3FF
00821 
00822 typedef unsigned int sph_u32;
00823 typedef int sph_s32;
00824 
00825 #define SPH_C32(x)    ((sph_u32)(x ## U))
00826 
00827 #else
00828 
00829 typedef unsigned long sph_u32;
00830 typedef long sph_s32;
00831 
00832 #define SPH_C32(x)    ((sph_u32)(x ## UL))
00833 
00834 #endif
00835 
00836 /*
00837  * We want a 64-bit type. We use "unsigned long" if it is wide enough (as
00838  * is common on 64-bit architectures such as AMD64, Alpha or Sparcv9),
00839  * "unsigned long long" otherwise, if available. We use ULLONG_MAX to
00840  * test whether "unsigned long long" is available; we also know that
00841  * gcc features this type, even if the libc header do not know it.
00842  */
00843 
00844 #if ((ULONG_MAX >> 31) >> 31) >= 3
00845 
00846 typedef unsigned long sph_u64;
00847 typedef long sph_s64;
00848 
00849 #define SPH_C64(x)    ((sph_u64)(x ## UL))
00850 
00851 #define SPH_64  1
00852 
00853 #elif ((ULLONG_MAX >> 31) >> 31) >= 3 || defined __GNUC__
00854 
00855 typedef unsigned long long sph_u64;
00856 typedef long long sph_s64;
00857 
00858 #define SPH_C64(x)    ((sph_u64)(x ## ULL))
00859 
00860 #define SPH_64  1
00861 
00862 #else
00863 
00864 /*
00865  * No 64-bit type...
00866  */
00867 
00868 #endif
00869 
00870 #endif
00871 
00872 /*
00873  * If the "unsigned long" type has length 64 bits or more, then this
00874  * is a "true" 64-bit architectures. FIXME: check on 64-bit Windows.
00875  */
00876 #if defined SPH_64 && ((ULONG_MAX >> 31) >> 31) >= 3
00877 #define SPH_64_TRUE   1
00878 #endif
00879 
00880 /*
00881  * Implementation note: some processors have specific opcodes to perform
00882  * a rotation. Recent versions of gcc recognize the expression above and
00883  * use the relevant opcodes, when appropriate.
00884  */
00885 
00886 #define SPH_T32(x)    ((x) & SPH_C32(0xFFFFFFFF))
00887 #define SPH_ROTL32(x, n)   SPH_T32(((x) << (n)) | ((x) >> (32 - (n))))
00888 #define SPH_ROTR32(x, n)   SPH_ROTL32(x, (32 - (n)))
00889 
00890 #ifdef SPH_64
00891 
00892 #define SPH_T64(x)    ((x) & SPH_C64(0xFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFF))
00893 #define SPH_ROTL64(x, n)   SPH_T64(((x) << (n)) | ((x) >> (64 - (n))))
00894 #define SPH_ROTR64(x, n)   SPH_ROTL64(x, (64 - (n)))
00895 
00896 #endif
00897 
00898 #ifndef DOXYGEN_IGNORE
00899 /*
00900  * Define SPH_INLINE to be an "inline" qualifier, if available. We define
00901  * some small macro-like functions which benefit greatly from being inlined.
00902  */
00903 #if (defined __STDC__ && __STDC_VERSION__ >= 199901L) || defined __GNUC__
00904 #define SPH_INLINE inline
00905 #elif defined _MSC_VER
00906 #define SPH_INLINE __inline
00907 #else
00908 #define SPH_INLINE
00909 #endif
00910 #endif
00911 
00912 /*
00913  * We define some macros which qualify the architecture.
00914  *
00915  * SPH_UPTR             if defined: unsigned type to cast pointers into
00916  *
00917  * SPH_UNALIGNED        defined if unaligned accesses are efficient
00918  * SPH_LITTLE_ENDIAN    defined if architecture is known to be little-endian
00919  * SPH_BIG_ENDIAN       defined if architecture is known to be big-endian
00920  * SPH_LITTLE_FAST      little-endian decoding is fast
00921  * SPH_BIG_FAST         big-endian decoding is fast
00922  *
00923  * If SPH_UPTR is defined, then encoding and decoding of 32-bit and 64-bit
00924  * values will try to be "smart". SPH_LITTLE_ENDIAN or SPH_BIG_ENDIAN
00925  * _must_ be defined in those situations. The 32-bit and 64-bit types
00926  * _must_ have an exact width.
00927  *
00928  * SPH_SPARCV9_GCC_32   UltraSPARC-compatible with gcc, 32-bit mode
00929  * SPH_SPARCV9_GCC_64   UltraSPARC-compatible with gcc, 64-bit mode
00930  * SPH_SPARCV9_GCC      UltraSPARC-compatible with gcc
00931  * SPH_I386_GCC         x86-compatible (32-bit) with gcc
00932  * SPH_I386_MSVC        x86-compatible (32-bit) with Microsoft Visual C 8
00933  * SPH_AMD64_GCC        x86-compatible (64-bit) with gcc
00934  * SPH_ARM_GCC          ARM-compatible, little-endian, with gcc
00935  */
00936 #undef SPH_UNALIGNED
00937 #undef SPH_LITTLE_ENDIAN
00938 #undef SPH_BIG_ENDIAN
00939 #if defined __i386__
00940 #define SPH_UNALIGNED       1
00941 #define SPH_LITTLE_ENDIAN   1
00942 #define SPH_UPTR            sph_u32
00943 #ifdef __GNUC__
00944 #define SPH_I386_GCC        1
00945 #endif
00946 #elif defined SPH_I386_MSVC
00947 #define SPH_UNALIGNED       1
00948 #define SPH_LITTLE_ENDIAN   1
00949 #define SPH_UPTR            sph_u32
00950 #elif defined __x86_64
00951 #define SPH_UNALIGNED       1
00952 #define SPH_LITTLE_ENDIAN   1
00953 #define SPH_UPTR            sph_u64
00954 #ifdef __GNUC__
00955 #define SPH_AMD64_GCC       1
00956 #endif
00957 #elif defined __sparcv9
00958 #ifdef __GNUC__
00959 #define SPH_SPARCV9_GCC_64  1
00960 #endif
00961 #define SPH_BIG_ENDIAN      1
00962 #define SPH_LITTLE_FAST     1
00963 #define SPH_UPTR            sph_u64
00964 #elif defined __sparc
00965 #define SPH_BIG_ENDIAN      1
00966 #define SPH_UPTR            sph_u32
00967 #elif defined __arm__ && __ARMEL__
00968 #define SPH_ARM_GCC         1
00969 #define SPH_LITTLE_ENDIAN   1
00970 #define SPH_UPTR            sph_u32
00971 #elif defined __ia64 || defined __ia64__ || defined __itanium__
00972 #if defined __BIG_ENDIAN__ || defined _BIG_ENDIAN
00973 #define SPH_BIG_ENDIAN      1
00974 #else
00975 #define SPH_LITTLE_ENDIAN   1
00976 #endif
00977 #if defined __LP64__ || defined _LP64
00978 #define SPH_UPTR            sph_u64
00979 #else
00980 #define SPH_UPTR            sph_u32
00981 #endif
00982 #elif MIPSEL || _MIPSEL || __MIPSEL || __MIPSEL__
00983 #define SPH_LITTLE_ENDIAN   1
00984 #elif MIPSEB || _MIPSEB || __MIPSEB || __MIPSEB__
00985 #define SPH_BIG_ENDIAN      1
00986 #endif
00987 
00988 #ifdef SPH_LITTLE_ENDIAN
00989 #define SPH_LITTLE_FAST     1
00990 #endif
00991 #ifdef SPH_BIG_ENDIAN
00992 #define SPH_BIG_FAST        1
00993 #endif
00994 
00995 #if defined SPH_SPARCV9_GCC_32 || defined SPH_SPARCV9_GCC_64
00996 #define SPH_SPARCV9_GCC     1
00997 #define SPH_LITTLE_FAST     1
00998 #endif
00999 
01000 #if defined SPH_I386_GCC && !defined SPH_NO_ASM
01001 
01002 /*
01003  * On x86 32-bit, with gcc, we use the bswapl opcode to byte-swap 32-bit
01004  * values.
01005  */
01006 
01007 static SPH_INLINE sph_u32
01008 sph_bswap32(sph_u32 x)
01009 {
01010         __asm__ __volatile__ ("bswapl %0" : "=r" (x) : "0" (x));
01011         return x;
01012 }
01013 
01014 #ifdef SPH_64
01015 
01016 static SPH_INLINE sph_u64
01017 sph_bswap64(sph_u64 x)
01018 {
01019         return ((sph_u64)sph_bswap32((sph_u32)x) << 32)
01020                 | (sph_u64)sph_bswap32((sph_u32)(x >> 32));
01021 }
01022 
01023 #endif
01024 
01025 #elif defined SPH_AMD64_GCC && !defined SPH_NO_ASM
01026 
01027 /*
01028  * On x86 64-bit, with gcc, we use the bswapl opcode to byte-swap 32-bit
01029  * and 64-bit values.
01030  */
01031 
01032 static SPH_INLINE sph_u32
01033 sph_bswap32(sph_u32 x)
01034 {
01035         __asm__ __volatile__ ("bswapl %0" : "=r" (x) : "0" (x));
01036         return x;
01037 }
01038 
01039 #ifdef SPH_64
01040 
01041 static SPH_INLINE sph_u64
01042 sph_bswap64(sph_u64 x)
01043 {
01044         __asm__ __volatile__ ("bswapq %0" : "=r" (x) : "0" (x));
01045         return x;
01046 }
01047 
01048 #endif
01049 
01050 /*
01051  * Disabled code. Apparently, Microsoft Visual C 2005 is smart enough
01052  * to generate proper opcodes for endianness swapping with the pure C
01053  * implementation below.
01054  *
01055 
01056 #elif defined SPH_I386_MSVC && !defined SPH_NO_ASM
01057 
01058 static __inline sph_u32 __declspec(naked) __fastcall
01059 sph_bswap32(sph_u32 x)
01060 {
01061         __asm {
01062                 bswap  ecx
01063                 mov    eax,ecx
01064                 ret
01065         }
01066 }
01067 
01068 #ifdef SPH_64
01069 
01070 static SPH_INLINE sph_u64
01071 sph_bswap64(sph_u64 x)
01072 {
01073         return ((sph_u64)sph_bswap32((sph_u32)x) << 32)
01074                 | (sph_u64)sph_bswap32((sph_u32)(x >> 32));
01075 }
01076 
01077 #endif
01078 
01079  *
01080  * [end of disabled code]
01081  */
01082 
01083 #else
01084 
01085 static SPH_INLINE sph_u32
01086 sph_bswap32(sph_u32 x)
01087 {
01088         x = SPH_T32((x << 16) | (x >> 16));
01089         x = ((x & SPH_C32(0xFF00FF00)) >> 8)
01090                 | ((x & SPH_C32(0x00FF00FF)) << 8);
01091         return x;
01092 }
01093 
01094 #ifdef SPH_64
01095 
01102 static SPH_INLINE sph_u64
01103 sph_bswap64(sph_u64 x)
01104 {
01105         x = SPH_T64((x << 32) | (x >> 32));
01106         x = ((x & SPH_C64(0xFFFF0000FFFF0000)) >> 16)
01107                 | ((x & SPH_C64(0x0000FFFF0000FFFF)) << 16);
01108         x = ((x & SPH_C64(0xFF00FF00FF00FF00)) >> 8)
01109                 | ((x & SPH_C64(0x00FF00FF00FF00FF)) << 8);
01110         return x;
01111 }
01112 
01113 #endif
01114 
01115 #endif
01116 
01117 #if defined SPH_SPARCV9_GCC && !defined SPH_NO_ASM
01118 
01119 /*
01120  * On UltraSPARC systems, native ordering is big-endian, but it is
01121  * possible to perform little-endian read accesses by specifying the
01122  * address space 0x88 (ASI_PRIMARY_LITTLE). Basically, either we use
01123  * the opcode "lda [%reg]0x88,%dst", where %reg is the register which
01124  * contains the source address and %dst is the destination register,
01125  * or we use "lda [%reg+imm]%asi,%dst", which uses the %asi register
01126  * to get the address space name. The latter format is better since it
01127  * combines an addition and the actual access in a single opcode; but
01128  * it requires the setting (and subsequent resetting) of %asi, which is
01129  * slow. Some operations (i.e. MD5 compression function) combine many
01130  * successive little-endian read accesses, which may share the same
01131  * %asi setting. The macros below contain the appropriate inline
01132  * assembly.
01133  */
01134 
01135 #define SPH_SPARCV9_SET_ASI   \
01136         sph_u32 sph_sparcv9_asi; \
01137         __asm__ __volatile__ ( \
01138                 "rd %%asi,%0\n\twr %%g0,0x88,%%asi" : "=r" (sph_sparcv9_asi));
01139 
01140 #define SPH_SPARCV9_RESET_ASI  \
01141         __asm__ __volatile__ ("wr %%g0,%0,%%asi" : : "r" (sph_sparcv9_asi));
01142 
01143 #define SPH_SPARCV9_DEC32LE(base, idx)   ({ \
01144                 sph_u32 sph_sparcv9_tmp; \
01145                 __asm__ __volatile__ ("lda [%1+" #idx "*4]%%asi,%0" \
01146                         : "=r" (sph_sparcv9_tmp) : "r" (base)); \
01147                 sph_sparcv9_tmp; \
01148         })
01149 
01150 #endif
01151 
01152 static SPH_INLINE void
01153 sph_enc16be(void *dst, unsigned val)
01154 {
01155         ((unsigned char *)dst)[0] = (val >> 8);
01156         ((unsigned char *)dst)[1] = val;
01157 }
01158 
01159 static SPH_INLINE unsigned
01160 sph_dec16be(const void *src)
01161 {
01162         return ((unsigned)(((const unsigned char *)src)[0]) << 8)
01163                 | (unsigned)(((const unsigned char *)src)[1]);
01164 }
01165 
01166 static SPH_INLINE void
01167 sph_enc16le(void *dst, unsigned val)
01168 {
01169         ((unsigned char *)dst)[0] = val;
01170         ((unsigned char *)dst)[1] = val >> 8;
01171 }
01172 
01173 static SPH_INLINE unsigned
01174 sph_dec16le(const void *src)
01175 {
01176         return (unsigned)(((const unsigned char *)src)[0])
01177                 | ((unsigned)(((const unsigned char *)src)[1]) << 8);
01178 }
01179 
01186 static SPH_INLINE void
01187 sph_enc32be(void *dst, sph_u32 val)
01188 {
01189 #if defined SPH_UPTR
01190 #ifdef SPH_UNALIGNED
01191 #ifdef SPH_LITTLE_ENDIAN
01192         val = sph_bswap32(val);
01193 #endif
01194         *(sph_u32 *)dst = val;
01195 #else
01196         if (((SPH_UPTR)val & 3) == 0) {
01197 #ifdef SPH_LITTLE_ENDIAN
01198                 val = sph_bswap32(val);
01199 #endif
01200                 *(sph_u32 *)dst = val;
01201         } else {
01202                 ((unsigned char *)dst)[0] = (val >> 24);
01203                 ((unsigned char *)dst)[1] = (val >> 16);
01204                 ((unsigned char *)dst)[2] = (val >> 8);
01205                 ((unsigned char *)dst)[3] = val;
01206         }
01207 #endif
01208 #else
01209         ((unsigned char *)dst)[0] = (val >> 24);
01210         ((unsigned char *)dst)[1] = (val >> 16);
01211         ((unsigned char *)dst)[2] = (val >> 8);
01212         ((unsigned char *)dst)[3] = val;
01213 #endif
01214 }
01215 
01223 static SPH_INLINE void
01224 sph_enc32be_aligned(void *dst, sph_u32 val)
01225 {
01226 #if defined SPH_LITTLE_ENDIAN
01227         *(sph_u32 *)dst = sph_bswap32(val);
01228 #elif defined SPH_BIG_ENDIAN
01229         *(sph_u32 *)dst = val;
01230 #else
01231         ((unsigned char *)dst)[0] = (val >> 24);
01232         ((unsigned char *)dst)[1] = (val >> 16);
01233         ((unsigned char *)dst)[2] = (val >> 8);
01234         ((unsigned char *)dst)[3] = val;
01235 #endif
01236 }
01237 
01244 static SPH_INLINE sph_u32
01245 sph_dec32be(const void *src)
01246 {
01247 #if defined SPH_UPTR
01248 #ifdef SPH_UNALIGNED
01249 #ifdef SPH_LITTLE_ENDIAN
01250         return sph_bswap32(*(const sph_u32 *)src);
01251 #else
01252         return *(const sph_u32 *)src;
01253 #endif
01254 #else
01255         if (((SPH_UPTR)src & 3) == 0) {
01256 #ifdef SPH_LITTLE_ENDIAN
01257                 return sph_bswap32(*(const sph_u32 *)src);
01258 #else
01259                 return *(const sph_u32 *)src;
01260 #endif
01261         } else {
01262                 return ((sph_u32)(((const unsigned char *)src)[0]) << 24)
01263                         | ((sph_u32)(((const unsigned char *)src)[1]) << 16)
01264                         | ((sph_u32)(((const unsigned char *)src)[2]) << 8)
01265                         | (sph_u32)(((const unsigned char *)src)[3]);
01266         }
01267 #endif
01268 #else
01269         return ((sph_u32)(((const unsigned char *)src)[0]) << 24)
01270                 | ((sph_u32)(((const unsigned char *)src)[1]) << 16)
01271                 | ((sph_u32)(((const unsigned char *)src)[2]) << 8)
01272                 | (sph_u32)(((const unsigned char *)src)[3]);
01273 #endif
01274 }
01275 
01283 static SPH_INLINE sph_u32
01284 sph_dec32be_aligned(const void *src)
01285 {
01286 #if defined SPH_LITTLE_ENDIAN
01287         return sph_bswap32(*(const sph_u32 *)src);
01288 #elif defined SPH_BIG_ENDIAN
01289         return *(const sph_u32 *)src;
01290 #else
01291         return ((sph_u32)(((const unsigned char *)src)[0]) << 24)
01292                 | ((sph_u32)(((const unsigned char *)src)[1]) << 16)
01293                 | ((sph_u32)(((const unsigned char *)src)[2]) << 8)
01294                 | (sph_u32)(((const unsigned char *)src)[3]);
01295 #endif
01296 }
01297 
01304 static SPH_INLINE void
01305 sph_enc32le(void *dst, sph_u32 val)
01306 {
01307 #if defined SPH_UPTR
01308 #ifdef SPH_UNALIGNED
01309 #ifdef SPH_BIG_ENDIAN
01310         val = sph_bswap32(val);
01311 #endif
01312         *(sph_u32 *)dst = val;
01313 #else
01314         if (((SPH_UPTR)val & 3) == 0) {
01315 #ifdef SPH_BIG_ENDIAN
01316                 val = sph_bswap32(val);
01317 #endif
01318                 *(sph_u32 *)dst = val;
01319         } else {
01320                 ((unsigned char *)dst)[0] = val;
01321                 ((unsigned char *)dst)[1] = (val >> 8);
01322                 ((unsigned char *)dst)[2] = (val >> 16);
01323                 ((unsigned char *)dst)[3] = (val >> 24);
01324         }
01325 #endif
01326 #else
01327         ((unsigned char *)dst)[0] = val;
01328         ((unsigned char *)dst)[1] = (val >> 8);
01329         ((unsigned char *)dst)[2] = (val >> 16);
01330         ((unsigned char *)dst)[3] = (val >> 24);
01331 #endif
01332 }
01333 
01341 static SPH_INLINE void
01342 sph_enc32le_aligned(void *dst, sph_u32 val)
01343 {
01344 #if defined SPH_LITTLE_ENDIAN
01345         *(sph_u32 *)dst = val;
01346 #elif defined SPH_BIG_ENDIAN
01347         *(sph_u32 *)dst = sph_bswap32(val);
01348 #else
01349         ((unsigned char *)dst)[0] = val;
01350         ((unsigned char *)dst)[1] = (val >> 8);
01351         ((unsigned char *)dst)[2] = (val >> 16);
01352         ((unsigned char *)dst)[3] = (val >> 24);
01353 #endif
01354 }
01355 
01362 static SPH_INLINE sph_u32
01363 sph_dec32le(const void *src)
01364 {
01365 #if defined SPH_UPTR
01366 #ifdef SPH_UNALIGNED
01367 #ifdef SPH_BIG_ENDIAN
01368         return sph_bswap32(*(const sph_u32 *)src);
01369 #else
01370         return *(const sph_u32 *)src;
01371 #endif
01372 #else
01373         if (((SPH_UPTR)src & 3) == 0) {
01374 #ifdef SPH_BIG_ENDIAN
01375 #if defined SPH_SPARCV9_GCC && !defined SPH_NO_ASM
01376                 sph_u32 tmp;
01377 
01378                 /*
01379                  * "__volatile__" is needed here because without it,
01380                  * gcc-3.4.3 miscompiles the code and performs the
01381                  * access before the test on the address, thus triggering
01382                  * a bus error...
01383                  */
01384                 __asm__ __volatile__ (
01385                         "lda [%1]0x88,%0" : "=r" (tmp) : "r" (src));
01386                 return tmp;
01387 #else
01388                 return sph_bswap32(*(const sph_u32 *)src);
01389 #endif
01390 #else
01391                 return *(const sph_u32 *)src;
01392 #endif
01393         } else {
01394                 return (sph_u32)(((const unsigned char *)src)[0])
01395                         | ((sph_u32)(((const unsigned char *)src)[1]) << 8)
01396                         | ((sph_u32)(((const unsigned char *)src)[2]) << 16)
01397                         | ((sph_u32)(((const unsigned char *)src)[3]) << 24);
01398         }
01399 #endif
01400 #else
01401         return (sph_u32)(((const unsigned char *)src)[0])
01402                 | ((sph_u32)(((const unsigned char *)src)[1]) << 8)
01403                 | ((sph_u32)(((const unsigned char *)src)[2]) << 16)
01404                 | ((sph_u32)(((const unsigned char *)src)[3]) << 24);
01405 #endif
01406 }
01407 
01415 static SPH_INLINE sph_u32
01416 sph_dec32le_aligned(const void *src)
01417 {
01418 #if defined SPH_LITTLE_ENDIAN
01419         return *(const sph_u32 *)src;
01420 #elif defined SPH_BIG_ENDIAN
01421 #if defined SPH_SPARCV9_GCC && !defined SPH_NO_ASM
01422         sph_u32 tmp;
01423 
01424         __asm__ __volatile__ ("lda [%1]0x88,%0" : "=r" (tmp) : "r" (src));
01425         return tmp;
01426 #else
01427         return sph_bswap32(*(const sph_u32 *)src);
01428 #endif
01429 #else
01430         return (sph_u32)(((const unsigned char *)src)[0])
01431                 | ((sph_u32)(((const unsigned char *)src)[1]) << 8)
01432                 | ((sph_u32)(((const unsigned char *)src)[2]) << 16)
01433                 | ((sph_u32)(((const unsigned char *)src)[3]) << 24);
01434 #endif
01435 }

01445 static SPH_INLINE void
01446 sph_enc64be(void *dst, sph_u64 val)
01447 {
01448 #if defined SPH_UPTR
01449 #ifdef SPH_UNALIGNED
01450 #ifdef SPH_LITTLE_ENDIAN
01451         val = sph_bswap64(val);
01452 #endif
01453         *(sph_u64 *)dst = val;
01454 #else
01455         if (((SPH_UPTR)val & 7) == 0) {
01456 #ifdef SPH_LITTLE_ENDIAN
01457                 val = sph_bswap64(val);
01458 #endif
01459                 *(sph_u64 *)dst = val;
01460         } else {
01461                 ((unsigned char *)dst)[0] = (val >> 56);
01462                 ((unsigned char *)dst)[1] = (val >> 48);
01463                 ((unsigned char *)dst)[2] = (val >> 40);
01464                 ((unsigned char *)dst)[3] = (val >> 32);
01465                 ((unsigned char *)dst)[4] = (val >> 24);
01466                 ((unsigned char *)dst)[5] = (val >> 16);
01467                 ((unsigned char *)dst)[6] = (val >> 8);
01468                 ((unsigned char *)dst)[7] = val;
01469         }
01470 #endif
01471 #else
01472         ((unsigned char *)dst)[0] = (val >> 56);
01473         ((unsigned char *)dst)[1] = (val >> 48);
01474         ((unsigned char *)dst)[2] = (val >> 40);
01475         ((unsigned char *)dst)[3] = (val >> 32);
01476         ((unsigned char *)dst)[4] = (val >> 24);
01477         ((unsigned char *)dst)[5] = (val >> 16);
01478         ((unsigned char *)dst)[6] = (val >> 8);
01479         ((unsigned char *)dst)[7] = val;
01480 #endif
01481 }

01505         ((unsigned char *)dst)[7] = val;

01517 {
01518 #if defined SPH_UPTR
01519 #ifdef SPH_UNALIGNED
01520 #ifdef SPH_LITTLE_ENDIAN
01521         return sph_bswap64(*(const sph_u64 *)src);
01522 #else
01523         return *(const sph_u64 *)src;
01524 #endif
01525 #else
01526         if (((SPH_UPTR)src & 7) == 0) {
01527 #ifdef SPH_LITTLE_ENDIAN
01528                 return sph_bswap64(*(const sph_u64 *)src);
01529 #else
01530                 return *(const sph_u64 *)src;
01531 #endif
01532         } else {
01533                 return ((sph_u64)(((const unsigned char *)src)[0]) << 56)
01534                         | ((sph_u64)(((const unsigned char *)src)[1]) << 48)
01535                         | ((sph_u64)(((const unsigned char *)src)[2]) << 40)
01536                         | ((sph_u64)(((const unsigned char *)src)[3]) << 32)
01537                         | ((sph_u64)(((const unsigned char *)src)[4]) << 24)
01538                         | ((sph_u64)(((const unsigned char *)src)[5]) << 16)
01539                         | ((sph_u64)(((const unsigned char *)src)[6]) << 8)
01540                         | (sph_u64)(((const unsigned char *)src)[7]);
01541         }
01542 #endif
01543 #else
01544         return ((sph_u64)(((const unsigned char *)src)[0]) << 56)
01545                 | ((sph_u64)(((const unsigned char *)src)[1]) << 48)
01546                 | ((sph_u64)(((const unsigned char *)src)[2]) << 40)
01547                 | ((sph_u64)(((const unsigned char *)src)[3]) << 32)
01548                 | ((sph_u64)(((const unsigned char *)src)[4]) << 24)
01549                 | ((sph_u64)(((const unsigned char *)src)[5]) << 16)
01550                 | ((sph_u64)(((const unsigned char *)src)[6]) << 8)
01551                 | (sph_u64)(((const unsigned char *)src)[7]);
01552 #endif
01553 }

01658 sph_dec64le(const void *src)
01659 {
01660 #if defined SPH_UPTR
01661 #ifdef SPH_UNALIGNED
01662 #ifdef SPH_BIG_ENDIAN
01663         return sph_bswap64(*(const sph_u64 *)src);
01664 #else
01665         return *(const sph_u64 *)src;
01666 #endif
01667 #else
01668         if (((SPH_UPTR)src & 7) == 0) {
01669 #ifdef SPH_BIG_ENDIAN
01670 #if defined SPH_SPARCV9_GCC_64 && !defined SPH_NO_ASM
01671                 sph_u64 tmp;
01672 
01673                 __asm__ __volatile__ (
01674                         "ldxa [%1]0x88,%0" : "=r" (tmp) : "r" (src));
01675                 return tmp;
01676 #else
01677                 return sph_bswap64(*(const sph_u64 *)src);
01678 #endif
01679 #else
01680                 return *(const sph_u64 *)src;
01681 #endif
01682         } else {
01683                 return (sph_u64)(((const unsigned char *)src)[0])
01684                         | ((sph_u64)(((const unsigned char *)src)[1]) << 8)
01685                         | ((sph_u64)(((const unsigned char *)src)[2]) << 16)
01686                         | ((sph_u64)(((const unsigned char *)src)[3]) << 24)
01687                         | ((sph_u64)(((const unsigned char *)src)[4]) << 32)
01688                         | ((sph_u64)(((const unsigned char *)src)[5]) << 40)
01689                         | ((sph_u64)(((const unsigned char *)src)[6]) << 48)
01690                         | ((sph_u64)(((const unsigned char *)src)[7]) << 56);
01691         }
01692 #endif
01693 #else
01694         return (sph_u64)(((const unsigned char *)src)[0])
01695                 | ((sph_u64)(((const unsigned char *)src)[1]) << 8)
01696                 | ((sph_u64)(((const unsigned char *)src)[2]) << 16)
01697                 | ((sph_u64)(((const unsigned char *)src)[3]) << 24)
01698                 | ((sph_u64)(((const unsigned char *)src)[4]) << 32)
01699                 | ((sph_u64)(((const unsigned char *)src)[5]) << 40)
01700                 | ((sph_u64)(((const unsigned char *)src)[6]) << 48)
01701                 | ((sph_u64)(((const unsigned char *)src)[7]) << 56);
01702 #endif
